title: Maddrey's Discriminant Function for Alcoholic Hepatitis
description: Predicts prognosis and steroid benefit in alcoholic hepatitis

ranges.description: Good prognosis, steroid therapy not indicated
ranges.interpretation: Mild to moderate alcoholic hepatitis with good prognosis. 90% survival rate at 30 days without steroid therapy. Steroid treatment not recommended.
Severe alcoholic hepatitis with poor prognosis. 35-45% mortality risk within first month. Consider corticosteroid therapy if no contraindications exist.

references: Maddrey WC, Boitnott JK, Bedine MS, Weber FL Jr, Mezey E, White RI Jr. Corticosteroid therapy of alcoholic hepatitis. Gastroenterology. 1978 Aug;75(2):193-9. PMID: 352788.

Carithers RL Jr, Herlong HF, Diehl AM, Shaw EW, Combes B, Fallon HJ, Maddrey WC. Methylprednisolone therapy in patients with severe alcoholic hepatitis. A randomized multicenter trial. Ann Intern Med. 1989 May 1;110(9):685-90. doi: 10.7326/0003-4819-110-9-685.

Louvet A, Naveau S, Abdelnour M, Ramond MJ, Diaz E, Fartoux L, et al. The Lille model: a new tool for therapeutic strategy in patients with severe alcoholic hepatitis treated with steroids. Hepatology. 2007 Jun;45(6):1348-54. doi: 10.1002/hep.21607.
formula: Maddrey's DF = 4.6 × (Patient's PT - Control PT) + Total Bilirubin
notes: Developed in 1978 by Maddrey et al. following a randomized controlled trial
First established clinical prognostic score for alcoholic hepatitis
Score ≥32 indicates severe alcoholic hepatitis with poor prognosis
Score <32 indicates mild to moderate disease with 90% 30-day survival without steroids
Patients with score ≥32 may benefit from corticosteroid therapy
Should be used in conjunction with contraindications assessment for steroids
Less useful for long-term prognosis prediction
MELD score may be more accurate for mortality prediction in some studies
Often combined with Lille score to assess treatment response
Control PT is typically 11-13 seconds in most laboratories
Requires exclusion of other causes of hepatitis and acute liver failure
Consider liver biopsy in patients with severe disease (score ≥32)
